summary:
I am full-time employed at the University of Applied Sciences. Centres of Expertise Urban Technology and Urban Governance and Social Innovation.

Always looking for (international) cooperation in R&I

- More than 23 year experience in energy, climate and environmental research and consultancy
- Very experienced Team Leader in (EU) technical assistance projects
- Coordination, development and drafting of technical proposals and tenders, including Horizon2020 and EuropeAid
- Climate change policy, mitigation and adaptation
- Carbon market mechanisms and emission trading
- NAMA and low emission development strategies
- Energy policy studies and implementation studies
- Energy efficiency and renewable energy policies
- Approximation to EU energy and climate acquis
- Housing management and urban regeneration. Low carbon urban development 
- Regional experience: EU, developing countries, Central and Eastern Europe, South East Europe
- Proposal/tender drafting and coordination (EC, EuropeAid, ADB)
- Technical assistance, training and capacity building 
- Public and private sector clients
- European Commission (CLIMA, DEVCO, EuropeAid), UNDP, EBRD, Worldbank. 

- personal website www.capsd.nl & www.sqconsult.com/team/mark-van-wees

I have a sound background in academic research and in energy and environmental analytical studies, which is a key asset for my current work in advisory and technical assistance on energy and climate change. On account of my broad experience, I am able to address and integrate energy and climate change policy issues within the overall context of green economic, low carbon and climate resilient development. 
My professional experience for both the private and public sector secures the ability to accommodate to different organisational and national/regional cultures and environments.I regard pleasant and motivating working environments as essential to achieving project results. I use my personal communication skills to create this environment, in particular as team leader. This has also benefited the beneficiaries of the technical assistance projects that I have developed and managed.

projects.title: Climate Change Strategy and Action Plan Serbia
projects.description: Mark van Wees is Team Leader. Preparation of a comprehensive national cross-sectoral climate change strategy and action plan for Serbia. Identification and assessment of cost-effective GHG mitigation potential for Serbia, while taking into account policies and goals, and assess opportunities for and costs of climate change adaptation. Implementation of the (i)NDC. A quantitative model (including PRIMES) is used for baseline and mitigation scenario analysis (2030 and 2050). Project budget € 1 million.

projects.title: Climate Change Strategy and Law on Climate Action FYR Macedonia
projects.description: Preparation of Terms of Reference for IPA TAIB 2012 service contract for Long-term strategy and Law on Climate Action (FYR Macedonia). This includes developing the project logframe, a road map for climate action (mitigation and adaptation), and drafting of the ToR for a large EU technical assistance project that will support the development and drafting of the Strategy and Law on Climate Action.

projects.title: Development program for energy saving in built environment in Armenia
projects.description: Development program for energy saving in built environment in Armenia Client: UNDP Armenia. Evaluation energy saving policy for buildings. Project documentation. Consultation of stakeholders. Impact evaluation.

projects.title: Developing, coordinating and writing project proposals and tenders
projects.description: Developing, coordinating and writing project proposals and tenders for different clients (ADB, EC, EuropeAid). Topics: energy saving, disaster risk management, renewable energy, climate, and climate-friendly urban development.

projects.title: Mainstreaming climate change in the EU regional financing facilities
projects.description: Since 2007, regional blending facilities have been set up by the EU for financing development project on third countries (combining grant and loan components). SQ participates in a team, headed by KPC, advising the European Commission on extending these facilities and on enhancing the involvement of the private sector. SQ Consult has addressed the mainstreaming of climate change mitigation and adaptation issues in the appraisal of investment proposals, as well as the financing of low carbon strategies and NAMAs through the WU blending facilities.

projects.title: Climate aspects of energy sector development in Serbia
projects.description: EU IPA. € 650k. Team Leader and climate change expert. EU Emission Trading Scheme in Serbia. Long term energy and emission scenarios for the energy sector. Potential new market mechanisms. Energy technology assessment. Capacity building and trainings.

projects.title: Social Housing in Armenia
projects.description: Netherlands Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Matra). (€600k). Team Leader  Support to development social housing sector. Feasibility studies. Policy and legislation. Technical assistance, capacity building and trainings.

projects.title: Energy Efficiency & Renewable Energy Legislation (Kazakhstan)
projects.description: SQ Consult supported the Kazakhstan government in drafting energy efficiency and renewable energy policy and legislation. The advice was based on an assessment of Dutch and international best practices. Topics included energy auditing and reporting, and voluntary agreements. Draft legislation was reviewed by SQ Consult.
